author: abdel.stark
content: Basically without <@&652918665943056397> on the network we are able to reach ~200% block elasticity (38M gas) for a long period to see how the base fee was increasing. And since <@&652918665943056397> joined as a validator we were not able to do that anymore

author: sky.cactus
content: They don't desync, the network just doesn't seem to hit 200%?

author: sky.cactus
content: Knowing nothing more than you described here, it sounds like when they mine a block they are simply not mining full blocks?

author: abdel.stark
content: I just restarted the stress test without them

author: abdel.stark
content: Just reached 190% block elasticity on block: http://eip1559-testnet.ops.pegasys.tech:3000/block/276242

author: abdel.stark
content: When <@&652918665943056397> validator was up we were below 20% always

author: Deleted User
content: <@!574864862338088960> Is that because Nethermind has more performance overheads (for engineering reasons) and starts to fall out of sync?

author: timbeiko
content: <@!636906092374261761> did you manage to get the geth implementation syncing on the testnet?

author: timbeiko
content: We have an implementers' call next Thursday, and I was wondering how realistic it is to expect Nethermind and Geth to be fully working on the PoA testnet so we can discuss how to move to a PoW one. <@!574864862338088960> has been doing some work generating large-state testnets which we'll hopefully have completed by the call as well.
